required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate Multiple Doses of GLPG2222 in Adult Subjects With Cystic Fibrosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IIa, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate Multiple Doses of GLPG2222 in Subjects With Cystic Fibrosis Who Are Homozygous for the F508del Mutation

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase IIa, multi-center, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group study to evaluate 4 different doses of GLPG2222 administered for 4 weeks to adult subjects with a confirmed diagnosis of CF and homozygous for the F508del Cystic Fibrosis Transmembrane conductance Regulator (CFTR) mutation.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with any treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) and serious or treatment-related TEAEs, as well as number of patients with TEAEs by worst intensity reported (mild, moderate, or severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Sweat Chloride Concentration at Day 29
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to dosing on Days 1 and 29, or at early discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: Two sweat collections, one from each arm, were obtained. Mean sweat chloride concentration was determined from both arms and measured as millimoles per liter (mmol/L). Baseline was defined as the predose value on Day 1 (or the last non-missing predose measurement).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Percent (%) Predicted FEV1 (%FEV1) at Day 29
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and between 1 and 2 hours postdose on Days 1 and 29, or at early discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: Percent predicted FEV1 for age, gender, and height was determined from standardized spirometry assessments and estimated using the 2012 Global Lungs Initiative equation. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing predose assessment on Day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in the Respiratory Domain of the Cystic Fibrosis Questionnaire-Revised (CFQ-R) at Day 29
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to dosing on Days 1 and 29, or at early discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: The CFQ-R is a validated participant-reported outcome measuring health-related quality of life for participants with cystic fibrosis. The respiratory domain assessed respiratory symptoms (for example, coughing, congestion, wheezing), derived from Questions 40, 41, 42, 45, and 46 if at least 50% of the questions had non-missing data. The scale score ranged from 0-100; higher scores indicated fewer symptoms and better health-related quality of life with a negative change indicating a worsening of symptoms. A change of 4 is considered clinically relevant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax; Nanograms Per Milliliter [mg/mL]) of GLPG2222
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15 (predose and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 hours postdose) and prior to dosing on Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum concentration of GLPG2222 after multiple dosing (ng/ML), obtained directly from the observed concentration versus time data. All pharmacokinetic (PK) parameters were determined from Day 15; Day 29 data were determined if the participant was not available for full PK profiling on Day 15.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean GLPG2222 Plasma Concentration Observed at Predose (Ctrough; ng/mL)
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma concentration of GLPG2222 observed at pre-dose (ng/mL), obtained directly from the observed concentration versus time data. Ctrough was calculated using both Day 15 and Day 29 PK data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Time to Occurrence of GLPG2222 Cmax (Tmax; Hours [h])
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15 (predose and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 hours postdose) and prior to dosing on Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Time of occurrence of maximum concentration of GLPG2222 after multiple dosing (h), obtained directly from the observed concentration versus time data. All PK parameters were determined from Day 15; Day 29 data were determined if the participant was not available for full PK profiling on Day 15.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve From Time 0 up to 24 Hours Following Multiple Dosing (AUC[0-t]; ng.h/mL) of GLPG2222
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15 (predose and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 hours postdose) and prior to dosing on Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time 0 up to 24 hours following multiple dosing (ng.h/mL), calculated by linear up/log down trapezoidal summation. All PK parameters were determined from Day 15; Day 29 data were determined if the participant was not available for full PK profiling on Day 15.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Cohort A: GLPG2222 50 mg once daily (QD)
arm_group.description: Participants received a single GLPG2222 50 mg tablet and two matching placebo tablets orally, QD for 29 days.
Participants received a single GLPG2222 100 mg tablet and two matching placebo tablets orally, QD for 29 days.
Participants received two GLPG2222 100 mg tablets and one matching placebo tablet orally, QD for 29 days.
Participants received two GLPG2222 150 mg tablets and one GLPG2222 100 mg tablet orally, QD for 29 days.
Participants received three matching placebo tablets, orally, QD for 29 days.
Participants received three matching placebo tablets, orally, QD for 29 days.

intervention.arm_group_label: Cohort A: GLPG2222 50 mg once daily (QD)
Cohort A: GLPG2222 50 mg once daily (QD)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female subject ≥ 18 years of age, on the day of signing the Informed Consent Form (ICF).
2. A confirmed clinical diagnosis of CF and homozygous for the F508del CFTR mutation
3. Weight ≥ 40 kg.
4. Stable concomitant treatment for at least 4 weeks (28 days) prior to baseline
5. Forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) ≥ 40% of predicted normal for age, gender and height at screening
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of clinically meaningful unstable or uncontrolled chronic disease that makes the subject unsuitable for inclusion in the study in the opinion of the investigator.
2. Unstable pulmonary status or respiratory tract infection requiring a change in therapy within 4 weeks of baseline.
3. Need for supplemental oxygen during the day, and >2 liters per minute (LPM) while sleeping.
4. Use of CFTR modulator therapy (e.g. lumacaftor or ivacaftor) within 4 weeks prior to the first study drug administration.
5. History of hepatic cirrhosis with portal hypertension.
6. Abnormal liver function test at screening; defined as aspartate aminotransferase (AST) and/or alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and/ or alkaline phosphatase and/or gamma-glutamyl transferase (GGT) ≥ 3x the upper limit of normal (ULN); and/or total bilirubin (>1.5 times ULN)
7. Estimated creatinine clearance < 60 mL/min using the Cockcroft-Gault formula at screening.

facility.name: Child Health Research Unit at UAB
University of Arkansas for medical Sciences
John Hopkins University School of Medicine
Mother and child health institute of Serbia

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events
measure.description: Number of participants with any treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) and serious or treatment-related TEAEs, as well as number of patients with TEAEs by worst intensity reported (mild, moderate, or severe).

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Sweat Chloride Concentration at Day 29
outcome.description: Two sweat collections, one from each arm, were obtained. Mean sweat chloride concentration was determined from both arms and measured as millimoles per liter (mmol/L). Baseline was defined as the predose value on Day 1 (or the last non-missing predose measurement).
outcome.time_frame: Prior to dosing on Days 1 and 29, or at early discontinuation
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population: all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study drug and had at least one post-baseline assessment with efficacy data. Only participants with non-missing data at baseline were included in the analysis; 3 participants had missing sweat chloride concentration data at baseline.

measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population: all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of study drug and had at least one post-baseline assessment with efficacy data. Only participants with non-missing data at baseline were included in the analysis; 3 participants had missing sweat chloride concentration data at baseline.

analysis.groups_desc: Day 29: GLPG2222 50 mg QD vs. Pooled Placebo
analysis.p_value_desc: P-value obtained from the Mixed Effects Model for Repeated Measures (MMRM) analysis with treatment as factor and baseline as covariate. Pairwise comparisons were not corrected for multiplicity.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in the Respiratory Domain of the Cystic Fibrosis Questionnaire-Revised (CFQ-R) at Day 29
outcome.description: The CFQ-R is a validated participant-reported outcome measuring health-related quality of life for participants with cystic fibrosis. The respiratory domain assessed respiratory symptoms (for example, coughing, congestion, wheezing), derived from Questions 40, 41, 42, 45, and 46 if at least 50% of the questions had non-missing data. The scale score ranged from 0-100; higher scores indicated fewer symptoms and better health-related quality of life with a negative change indicating a worsening of symptoms. A change of 4 is considered clinically relevant.

outcome.title: Mean Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax; Nanograms Per Milliliter [mg/mL]) of GLPG2222
outcome.description: Maximum concentration of GLPG2222 after multiple dosing (ng/ML), obtained directly from the observed concentration versus time data. All pharmacokinetic (PK) parameters were determined from Day 15; Day 29 data were determined if the participant was not available for full PK profiling on Day 15.
outcome.time_frame: Day 15 (predose and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 hours postdose) and prior to dosing on Day 29
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Population: all participants who were exposed to GLPG2222 and who had available and evaluable PK data (excluding all protocol violations/deviations or adverse events that may have had an impact on the PK analysis). Data were not calculable for 1 patient.

event.sub_title: Infective pulmonary exacerbation of cystic fibrosis
Infective pulmonary exacerbation of cystic fibrosis

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The investigator must agree that before publishing or communicating any results of the trial, the sponsor has at least 90 days for full review of the information prior to submission.
